step1_initial_points.title: Limited Visibility of AI Market
step1_initial_points.description: DPC lacks a comprehensive understanding of the current landscape of AI tools and solutions available to support State government operations, requiring market scanning to inform their catalogue of offerings.

step1_initial_points.title: Operational Efficiency Pressures
step1_initial_points.description: Government agencies are under pressure to boost efficiency. DPC is specifically seeking innovative AI technologies that can enhance efficiency across government functions.

step1_initial_points.title: Need for Data-Driven Decision Making
step1_initial_points.description: Agencies require better tools to inform decision-making. DPC aims to identify solutions that leverage AI to improve the quality and speed of government decisions.

step1_initial_points.title: Service Delivery & Public Satisfaction
step1_initial_points.description: There is a strategic need to improve service delivery and increase public satisfaction. DPC is exploring technologies to achieve better community outcomes through innovation.

step1_initial_points.title: Integration with Legacy Systems
step1_initial_points.description: DPC is concerned about the integration of new AI tools with existing platforms. They need to assess the maturity, scalability, and adaptability of solutions for seamless implementation.

step1_initial_points.title: Data Privacy and Sovereignty
step1_initial_points.description: Strict adherence to South Australian Information Privacy Principles is required. DPC needs to understand vendor data usage policies and measures to protect sensitive information.

step1_initial_points.title: Regulatory & Security Compliance
step1_initial_points.description: AI tools must comply with applicable ICT, Security, and Cyber policies. DPC faces the challenge of vetting solutions against these rigorous public sector standards.

step1_initial_points.title: Third-Party & LLM Risk Management
step1_initial_points.description: The use of third-party offerings, particularly Large Language Models (LLMs), poses security risks. DPC requires clear articulation of how these integrations are secured and safeguarded.

step1_initial_points.title: Budgeting and Cost Uncertainty
step1_initial_points.description: DPC lacks clear pricing data for AI implementations. They need indicative costing models to inform future procurement planning and budget allocation.

step1_initial_points.title: Technology Maturity & Reliability
step1_initial_points.description: To mitigate failure risks, DPC needs evidence of technical capability, reliability, and performance history in environments similar to the government sector.

step1_initial_points.title: Internal Workforce Capability
step1_initial_points.description: Deploying AI requires specific skills. DPC needs to identify the staff and tool training needed to ensure their teams can operate new solutions effectively.

step1_initial_points.title: Infrastructure Readiness
step1_initial_points.description: There is uncertainty regarding the resources required for AI. DPC needs to determine what technical infrastructure is necessary to support deployment.

step1_initial_points.title: Validating Vendor Experience
step1_initial_points.description: DPC wants to learn from vendor experiences in similar sectors to avoid pitfalls, seeking lessons learned and best practices from successful government deployments.

step1_initial_points.title: Facilitating Pilot Initiatives
step1_initial_points.description: There is a need to safely trial technologies before full rollout. DPC is looking for opportunities for partnership and pilot initiatives to test solutions in real-world scenarios.

pain_points_final.title: Strict Security & Privacy Compliance
pain_points_final.description: Public sector adoption is paralyzed by risks regarding data sovereignty, SA privacy principles, and third-party LLM vulnerabilities. DPC requires rigorous validation of data protection mechanisms and compliance with ICT security policies to mitigate sensitive data exposure.

pain_points_final.title: Strategic Service Delivery Pressures
pain_points_final.description: Agencies face immense pressure to modernize but lack the tools to balance operational efficiency with citizen satisfaction. Solutions must move beyond novelty to deliver measurable improvements in community outcomes and data-driven decision-making.

pain_points_final.title: Legacy Integration & Tech Readiness
pain_points_final.description: Uncertainty surrounds the compatibility of AI with aging legacy platforms. DPC faces high technical risk without clear evidence of scalability, API adaptability, and the infrastructure overhead required for seamless implementation alongside existing systems.

pain_points_final.title: Technology Maturity & Vendor Provenance
pain_points_final.description: To mitigate public sector risk, DPC cannot rely on unproven tech. They urgently need evidence of successful government track records, validated use cases, and lessons learned to justify the leap from pilot initiatives to full-scale production.

pain_points_final.title: Budgeting & Cost Model Uncertainty
pain_points_final.description: DPC lacks the pricing data necessary for procurement planning. Without transparent, indicative costing models, agencies cannot secure funding or accurately forecast the total cost of ownership required to transition from concept to capability.
